article_title: Bret Stephens: Obama Against the Obvious
article_text:
As headlines go, “Obama Moves Close to Calling Russian Action in Ukraine an Invasion,” from a weekend story in the New York Times, must surely rank among the year’s most revealing. The Obama presidency has long been at odds with the obvious. Once this was called hope.

Now it is generally recognized as farce.

Mr. Obama’s move comes after eight months of semantic obfuscation conducted in the service of political expediency. “I...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Global View columnist Bret Stephens writes that with Russian tanks and troops swarming into Ukraine, the president finally sees the light.
twitter.creator: @StephensWSJ

article_metadata.author: Bret Stephens

article_summary:
As headlines go, “Obama Moves Close to Calling Russian Action in Ukraine an Invasion,” from a weekend story in the New York Times, must surely rank among the year’s most revealing.
The Obama presidency has long been at odds with the obvious.
Mr. Obama’s move comes after eight months of semantic obfuscation conducted in the service of political expediency.
Now it is generally recognized as farce.
Once this was called hope.
